h2d.Tile.fromPixels.doc: Creates new POT Texture from Pixels and returns a Tile representing it.

h2d.Tile.fromTexture.doc: Create new Tile from provided Texture instance.

h2d.Tile.x.doc: Horizontal position of the Tile on the Texture. Cannot be modified directly, use Tile.setPosition instead.

h2d.Tile.xFlip.doc: The flip state of the Tile.

h2d.Tile.flipX.doc: Flips the Tile horizontally. Note that dx is flipped as well.

h2d.Tile.dx.doc: Visual offset of the Tile along the X axis during rendering.

h2d.Tile.ix.doc: An integer horizontal position of the Tile on the Texture.Alias to Math.floor(tile.x).

h2d.Tile.switchTexture.doc: Changes this Tile underlying texture to one used in the specified Tile. If Tile was scaled, new uv will cover new width and height instead of the original unscaled one. @:privateAccess tile.setTexture(myTextureInstance);

flixel.FlxBasic.draw.doc: Override this function to control how the object is drawn.Doing so is rarely necessary, but can be very useful.

flixel.FlxBasic.destroy.doc: WARNING: A destroyed FlxBasic can't be used anymore.It may even cause crashes if it is still part of a group or state.You may want to use kill() instead if you want to disable the object temporarily only and revive() it later. This function is usually not called manually (Flixel calls it automatically during state switches for all add()ed objects). Override this function to null out variables manually or call destroy() on class members if necessary.Don't forget to call super.destroy()!

flixel.FlxBasic.ID.doc: A unique ID starting from 0 and increasing by 1 for each subsequent FlxBasic that is created.

flixel.FlxBasic.update.doc: Override this function to update your class's position and appearance.This is where most of your game rules and behavioral code will go.
